_metadata.description: API Keys (ENV-first; no secrets in repo)

notes.api_documentation: Many integrated APIs have documentation available directly in Cursor. Use @Docs to access SDK references for: Supabase, Stripe, Twilio, Resend, and other supported services.
notes.security_warning: Keep this file secure! It contains sensitive credentials. Never commit to public repositories. Add to .gitignore if stored locally. service_role_key should ONLY be used server-side.
supabase_setup: 1. Install the client library: npm install @supabase/supabase-js
2. Copy env_local content to your .env.local file
3. Initialize client with EXPO_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL and EXPO_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_KEY
policy: Do not store secrets in this file in real repositories.
For Expo, only variables prefixed EXPO_PUBLIC_ are bundled to the client.
All non-EXPO_PUBLIC_ keys are server-only (Supabase Edge Functions, Node backend, or secure proxy).
